attr.value: Hoard battle-gear items may be played at this site.

card.text: Playable at any non-haven [H] Elf-hold not in Eriador, Gondor, or Wilderland if the influence check is greater than 11. Standard Modifications: Dwarves (-2), Elves (+2), Men (-2), any non-animal faction in play at any version of this site (-5).Cannot be duplicated at a given site. tap: take one Lingerers from your discard pile to your play deck.

Hidden site. Unless the company contains an Ironfist Dwarf, tap a sage or Dwarf to reveal this site. A character at this site may at any time store a ring or treasure item he bears to make the Ironfists faction playable that turn.

give +2 to the moral and force of Balcoth.

card.name: Bereth
card.text: Unique. Can use spirit-magic. If at any of her home sites she may tap to bring one Variag Priestess from your discard pile to your hand.

card.name: Bharâm
card.text: Unique. If a manifestation of Ren the Unclean or Ûvatha the Horseman is in play: +1 to his prowess and EI and he becomes a leader. -1 to the body of any Dragon or Drake strike he faces.

attr.value: Ulk Chey Sart, Ulk Jey Ama

card.name: Bounty of the Earth-maidens
card.text: Playable on Gyogorasag Sanctuary if you have Ent-wives in play. One of the following items is playable at the site (even if tapped) each turn: Athelas, Ent-draughts, Healing Herbs, Miruvor or Old Vinyards. Additionally, your rolls for Early Harvest are modified by +3. Place each successfully played Early Harvest with this card. This card is worth 1 extra mp for each Early Harvest attached. Radagast receives full mp for this card. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Byrillium-lode
card.text: Ore. Playable on an Elf or Dwarf during the site phase at a Ruins & Lairs [R] in a mountain region, if you have a Dwarf or Elf faction in play. Tap the character. If at a hold, you may attach this card to a faction you have in play at the site or to a treasure item in the company. This card is worth half the faction’s mp or half the item’s mp (round down). Cannot be duplicated on a given faction or item. Byrillium-lode is worth full mp to an Dwarf-lord or Elf-lord player.

card.name: Channels of Chey
card.text: Magic. Shadow-magic. Ritual. Playable on a company with a shadow-magic using character during the site phase. Make a body check for a non-Wizard hero character at the same site. Modify the body check by +1 for every 5 mind of magic users you choose to tap. If the hero is eliminated, you receive his kill mp and this card is removed from the game. Unless he is a Ringwraith, the shadow-magic using character makes a CC modified by -5.

card.name: Chey
card.text: Unique. Playable at Chey Muhn if the influence check is greater than 8Standard Modifications: if you are Ren the Ringwraith (+3)

attr.value: (1st) Men — 5 strikes with 8 prowess; (2nd) Demon — 2 strikes with 12 prowess

Any gold ring stored at this site is automatically tested (modify the roll by -2). If one of your companies is at this site, all attacks against it are cancelled.

Contains a hoard. Ghosts and Ghouls may be played keyed to this site.

card.name: Daurukh
card.text: Unique. +2 EI against factions playable at his home sites. If a at Border-hold [B] other than his home sites, you may discard a Blasting Fire, Dwarven Fire, or Liquid Fire to take either one Burning Rick, Cot, and Tree or a Tempest of Fire from your discard pile to your hand.

card.name: Dorwinrim School of Diplomacy
card.text: Lore. Playable on a non-overt, non-avatar diplomat during the site phase at Riavod, if you have Men of Dorwinion in play. Tap the diplomat. Target diplomat may tap and discard any treasure from the company or Gifts as Given of Old from hand to cancel a Dúnadan, Dragon, Dwarf, Elf, Man, Orc or Slayer attack. Any treasure item may be discarded instead of the listed items for Token of Goodwill. Additionally, target diplomat need not tap to play Ruse or Ready to His Will.Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Eastward in His Hunting
card.text: If you are Alatar or an Elf-lord, spawn events are considered hazard creatures for the purpose of The Hunt and The Great Hunt: you face them as if attacked by the automatic-attack they create. If you are Pallando or a DÃºnadan-lord, your non-unique weapons are considered Dagger of Westernesse for the purpose of interpreting Barrow-blade; if Barrow-blade is played on it, discard any other resource event played on it.

attr.value: w w w s s w
(1st) Traps (Hot Springs) — each character faces a strike with 7 prowess;(2nd) Elves — 3 strikes with 9 prowess (detainment against a covert company);
A minion company may not attack another company at this site. A Ringwraith may not move to this site.
If this site is not a Ruins & Lairs [R], Men of Dorwinion faction may be played at this site by the bearer of a mind ring; any influence attempt against this faction at this site is modified by +2.
If this site is not a Ruins & Lairs [R], Men of Dorwinion faction may be played at this site by the bearer of a mind ring; any influence attempt against this faction at this site is modified by +2.

card.name: Emissary of Doom
card.text: Fallen-wizard only. Playable on a diplomat character in your Wizard’s company. Target diplomat’s EI is 0. +3 to his influence attempts and he suffers no negative modifications according to his race. Additionally, he may make an influence attempt against a resource played on a site (as if a character with mind 5); subtract the number of opponent’s characters at the site from the roll. After a failed influence attempt by the diplomat against an opponent’s character or resource, you may take one diplomat only card played on the attempt to your hand (instead of discarding it).

card.name: Ered Harmal*
card.text: Playable at the end of the organization phase on a company containing a ranger. If the company moves with region movement, tap a ranger to move as if the following pairs of regions were adjacent: Heb Aaraan and Khand, Heb Aaraan and Lurmsakun, Khand and Nurad, Lurmsakun and Nurad. The company faces an attack at the beginning of its movement/hazard phase: Orcs — 2 strikes with 7 prowess. Alternatively, if the site moved to is in one of the regions listed above, the hazard limit is reduced by 2 (to a minimum of 2). Cannot be duplicated on a given company.

card.name: Fire-blade of Sen Jey
card.text: Unique. Playable on Ren the Ringwraith at any non-Free-hold site in Great Central Plains (does not tap the site). Cannot be transferred. This item affects Ren; he gains the warrior skill and cannot be taken back to hand on a body check of 7 or 8. tap: prevent The Fiery Blade from being discarded from play.

card.name: Fire-priest of Chey
card.text: Place this card on Ren the Ringwraith if in play as your Ringwraith; he becomes a Warlord and a leader. You may play this card in lieu of a minor item in your starting company and start the game at Chey Goumal; Ren gains this site as a home site. Discard this card to take Fire-blade of Sen Jey from your discard pile to your hand.Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Gabmog the Dimwitted
card.text: Unique. Leader. +2 EI against Orcs. +1 prowess against Dwarves. Discard on a body check result of 8. Gabmog must be chosen for any riddling roll in his company.

card.name: Gorovod
card.text: Unique. Can use shadow-magic. May play Freeze the Flesh on an eliminated horse ally, Zûrafa or Oliphant (as if a character). tap: make a CC modified by -2 and eliminate a horse ally or Zûrafy in the company to heal a character in the company.

Discard to give bearer +5 against all heat based attacks till end of the turn (Dragonâ€™s Breath e.g.).

card.name: Logath Herdsmen
card.text: Unique. Playable at Logath Camp if the influence check is greater than 8. Standard Modifications: Men (+1). tap: give -2 prowess to any Animal or Wolf creature attack against one of your companies in Wilderland or the Great Central Plains.

card.name: Long They Journeyed
card.text: You may start the game with this card in lieu of playing a minor item. Cannot be duplicated by a given player. Discard this card to take a non-character manifestation of a Wizard from your play deck to your hand. Pallando or Saruman specific. Your avatar may be brought into play at any non-Dark-hold [D] Man-hold where you have a faction in play.

card.name: Make League and Common Council
card.text: Playable only on your starting company in lieu of a minor item. You may start the game at any Haven [H] not in Eriador, Gondor or Wilderland. To start the game at such a site, your starting company must contain at least three characters of different race (Wizard counts as a race) and no non-Wizard characters without a home site in the same territory as your starting site (or in regions adjacent to this site).If you start your Wizard in this fashion he requires only 10 initial mind instead of 12.

card.name: Maran
card.text: Unique. +2 EI against characters and factions only playable at site in Forrhun or regions adjacent. Discard if in an overt company. Lords and Fallen-wizards may bring Maran into play with Seyrans company. Any Trained Falcon he controls receives +1 to body.

attr.value: Tap a scout during the site phase to play a horse ally from opponent's hand, which he has revealed to you through a mechanism of the game (regardless of any playability requirements).
Men — each character faces a strike with 6 prowess (detainment against covert companies)
Discard an item from the company to make any non-unique horse ally playable at the site until the end of the turn. The Nûriags faction is playable at this site.

card.name: Midhir
card.text: Unique. Silvan. +2 EI against Silvan Elves.+2 EI against the Taarum Elves faction.

card.name: Mission to the East
card.text: Playable if you are Alatar, Pallando or Saruman and you have 6 P or more. Playable on a Border-hold [B] or Shadow-hold [S] with a Man automatic-attack in any territory east of Wilderland, if you have played a faction at the site. The site becomes a Wizardhaven [H] and loses all automatic-attacks. Nothing is considered playable as written on the site card. Cannot be duplicated on a given site.

card.name: Morinehtar
card.text: Unique. Manifestation of Alatar. White and grey player only. Playable on a non-overt company without a Wizard, at or moving to a site in Great Central Plains, The Northern Waste, The Sunlands or The Uttersouth. You may play spells on the company as if on Alatar (except Sacrifice of Form or True Fána; no CC required). tap: give all characters of a chosen race +1 prowess and +1 body till the end of the turn if moving to or at Shadow-hold [S], Dark-hold [D], Dragon's Lair, or any site with a Spawn automatic-attack. Discard this card to modify the body of a non-CvCC attack against the company by -2. Discard this card when Alatar enters play or if you have 10 or more P. Invert this card during your untap phase; if inverted, discard this card at the end of the turn.

card.name: Orthir
card.text: Unique. Silvan. +2 EI against Silvan Elves.

card.name: Ovatha's Bow
card.text: Unique. Playable at Sturlurtsa. Weapon. Warrior only: +2 prowess to a maximum of 8. If borne by a character with a home site in Khand, Horse Plains or regions adjacent to these: tap: remain untapped against a strike from an attack that does not choose defending characters and is not keyed to a site. tap: before strike assignment in CvCC to wound a horse ally in opponent’s company.

card.name: Path of Virtue
card.text: Playable on a Man character in a company with at least one Elf, Dwarf, or Dúnadan, after defeating an attack by Orcs or Trolls. +1 prowess against Orcs and Trolls. +1 to all his CC.

card.name: Path to Vileness
card.text: Playable on a Man character in an overt company that has just defeated an attack by Elves, Dwarves, or Dúnedain. +2 EI against Orcs and Trolls. +1 prowess against attacks of the types listed above, and such attacks are never detainment against his company.

card.name: Rebellion amongst the Houses
card.text: Minion only. Playable on a company. If the company is at a Dwarf-hold and an opponentâ€™s company there contains a Dwarf and has a lower company size, CvCC may be initiated and cannot be cancelled. After this CvCC, tap a Dwarf to transfer one resource which gives miscellanous mp, from an opponentâ€™s character to one of your unwounded Dwarves, or from opponentâ€™s site version to the Dwarf-hold. Place this card with it; it is worth 2 mp and opponentâ€™s resource is not worth any mp. Cannot be duplicated on a company.

card.name: Ring of Frost
card.text: Unique. Ring. Playable at Elyamû, if you have played a Binding Ring at the site. Replace Binding Ring with Ring of Frost and remove Binding Ring from play. Bearer can use sorcery. +1 to bearer’s mind and +3 to his EI. tap: take one Bitter Cold to hand instead of discarding it from play. At the end of each untap phase, bearer must make a roll: if the result is higher than his mind he is tapped (or eliminated if he was wounded).

card.name: Royal Envoy
card.text: Playable on a Dúnadan character with a home site not in Eriador or Gondor. Tap character if untapped. +2 to his EI against characters and factions playable at sites in his home siteâ€™s territory, and he may tap to untap such a character or faction. Cannot be duplicated on a given character.

card.name: Ruler of Rulers
card.text: Pallando specific. Playable on one of your Wizard- havens [H] (except Isengard or The White Towers). If the site is a hold for any race, any hazard attack of that type becomes detainment against Pallando´s company; any character of that race in Pallando’s company receives +1 prowess in CvCC. Additionally, any unique faction played at a site in Ormal Bay, the Great Central Plains, Sunlands or Uttersouth, counts as two factions for the purpose of Prophet of Doom. Cannot be duplicated.

card.name: Seyran
card.text: Unique. +1 prowess against Men. If at the same site as a Ringwraith, +2 to his prowess and mind and he becomes a leader. If in the company with a Wizard, he may play and use mind rings as hero items.

attr.value: Men — 4 strikes with 7 prowess (detainment if the company contains only men)

card.name: Taarum Elves
card.text: Unique. Playable at Elanthia if the influence check is greater than 10.Standard Modifications: Dúnedain (+1) Dwarves (-1) Elves (+2), Men (-2)This faction is worth 2 mp if no manifestation of Ren the Unclean is in play. tap: shuffle one Ered Harmal from your discard pile to your play deck.

attr.value: You may discard a minor item from the company during the site phase to heal a character in the company (from wounded to untapped).
During the site phase, discard a minor item from a company at the site to heal a character in the company (from to wounded to untapped), or to remove one corruption card from the company.

card.name: The Baradhrim League
card.text: Playable on your Ringwraith, if he is in Heralded Lord mode and at a site in Harrhûn, Horse Plains, Khand, Kykurian, Kyn, Nûrad or Nuriag. Discard this card to allow his company to move with region movement to any site in these regions. Any character with a home site in these regions may be brought into play with your Ringwraith at Mistrand. If you have in play at least 4 factions playable at sites in the above named regions, this card is worth 2 mp and you may play Favoured by the Eye on your Ringwraith (without any other requirements). Cannot be duplicated by a given player.

attr.value: (1st) Lava Flows — each character faces a strike with 7 prowess; (2nd) Opponent may play as an automatic- attack one non-unique hazard creature from his hand normally keyed to Ruins & Lairs [R]

card.name: The Road to the West
card.text: Playable if you have an Elf faction in play. Rotate this card 90° (or place a token) when you move to a Refuge site or you turn a Ruins & Lairs [R] into a Hidden Site. You may only rotate this card for one site in a given territory. When this card is rotated 360°, place it in your mp: it is worth 4 mp and your Elf characters receive +1 to their CC. Cannot duplicated by a given player.

card.name: Trained Falcon
card.text: Playable at any tapped Border-hold [B] in the Great Central Plains. Discard if controlled by an overt character. Cannot be duplicated in a given company. Discard and name a hazard creature in opponent’s discard pile which has been revealed to you through a mechanism of the game: the creature attacks the company. tap: cancel any effect that causes a hazard creature to choose defending characters in the company. tap: cancel a strike (not from an automatic-attack) against itself.

card.name: Uiendarlaif
card.text: Animals. Wolves. 5 strikes. +2 prowess against animal and horse allies. May be played keyed to any region in the Great Central Plains and regions adjacent to these (except Coastal Sea [c] regions). If Worn and Famished is in play, may also be played keyed to Southern Rhovanion and its adjacent regions. Each excess strike assigned gives a -2 modification to prowess.
